name: Thai Family Relationships
description: Essential Thai vocabulary for family members and relationships

cards.context: Basic term for father; used both to refer to and address one's father

examples.original: พ่อของฉันเป็นครู
examples.translation: My father is a teacher
examples.phonetic: por kong chan pen kroo

examples.original: พ่อครับ/คะ หนูหิว
examples.translation: Dad, I'm hungry (male/female child)
examples.phonetic: por krap/ka, noo hiw

cards.context: Basic term for mother; used both to refer to and address one's mother

examples.original: แม่ของเขาทำงานที่โรงพยาบาล
examples.translation: His mother works at a hospital
examples.phonetic: mae kong kao tam-ngan tee rong-pa-ya-ban

examples.original: แม่คะ/ครับ หนูจะไปโรงเรียน
examples.translation: Mom, I'm going to school (female/male child)
examples.phonetic: mae ka/krap, noo ja pai rong-rian

cards.context: Term for an older brother; Thai distinguishes siblings by their relative age

examples.original: พี่ชายของฉันอายุ 25 ปี
examples.translation: My older brother is 25 years old
examples.phonetic: pee chai kong chan a-yu yee-sip-ha pee

examples.original: พี่ชายคะ/ครับ ช่วยทำการบ้านหน่อย
examples.translation: Big brother, can you help with homework? (female/male speaker)
examples.phonetic: pee chai ka/krap, chuay tam garn-ban noi

cards.context: Term for an older sister; Thai distinguishes siblings by their relative age

examples.original: พี่สาวของผมเป็นแพทย์
examples.translation: My older sister is a doctor (♂)
examples.phonetic: pee sao kong pom pen paet

examples.original: พี่สาวคะ/ครับ ไปซื้อของกันไหม
examples.translation: Big sister, shall we go shopping? (female/male speaker)
examples.phonetic: pee sao ka/krap, pai seu kong gan mai

cards.context: Term for a younger brother; Thai distinguishes siblings by their relative age

examples.original: น้องชายของฉันเรียนอยู่ชั้นประถม
examples.translation: My younger brother is in elementary school
examples.phonetic: nong chai kong chan rian yu chan pra-thom

examples.original: น้องชาย อย่าเล่นเสียงดัง
examples.translation: Little brother, don't play so loudly
examples.phonetic: nong chai, ya len siang dang

cards.context: Term for a younger sister; Thai distinguishes siblings by their relative age

examples.original: น้องสาวของเขาชอบวาดรูป
examples.translation: His younger sister likes to draw
examples.phonetic: nong sao kong kao chob wat roop

examples.original: น้องสาวคนเล็กของบ้านเราน่ารักมาก
examples.translation: The youngest sister in our family is very cute
examples.phonetic: nong sao kon lek kong ban rao na-rak maak

cards.context: Term for a son, literally 'male child'

examples.original: ลูกชายของเราเรียนเก่งมาก
examples.translation: Our son studies very well
examples.phonetic: look chai kong rao rian geng maak

examples.original: คุณมีลูกชายกี่คน
examples.translation: How many sons do you have?
examples.phonetic: khun mee look chai gee kon

cards.context: Term for a daughter, literally 'female child'

examples.original: ลูกสาวของเธอน่ารักจัง
examples.translation: Your daughter is so cute
examples.phonetic: look sao kong ter na-rak jang

examples.original: ลูกสาวของเราอายุห้าขวบ
examples.translation: Our daughter is five years old
examples.phonetic: look sao kong rao a-yu ha kuap

cards.context: Formal term for husband

examples.original: สามีของฉันทำงานที่บริษัทต่างชาติ
examples.translation: My husband works at a foreign company
examples.phonetic: sa-mee kong chan tam-ngan tee bo-ri-sat tang-chat

examples.original: สามีของเธอเป็นคนใจดี
examples.translation: Her husband is a kind person
examples.phonetic: sa-mee kong ter pen kon jai dee

cards.context: Formal term for wife

examples.original: ภรรยาของผมเป็นคนไทย
examples.translation: My wife is Thai (male speaker)
examples.phonetic: pan-ra-ya kong pom pen kon thai

examples.original: ภรรยาของเขาทำอาหารอร่อยมาก
examples.translation: His wife cooks very delicious food
examples.phonetic: pan-ra-ya kong kao tam a-han a-roi maak

cards.context: Father's father; Thai distinguishes between maternal and paternal grandparents

examples.original: ปู่ของฉันอายุ 80 ปีแล้ว
examples.translation: My paternal grandfather is already 80 years old
examples.phonetic: poo kong chan a-yu paet-sip pee laew

examples.original: ปู่ชอบเล่านิทานให้ฟัง
examples.translation: Grandfather likes to tell stories
examples.phonetic: poo chob lao ni-tan hai fang

cards.context: Father's mother; Thai distinguishes between maternal and paternal grandparents

examples.original: ย่าทำขนมอร่อยมาก
examples.translation: Paternal grandmother makes very delicious desserts
examples.phonetic: ya tam ka-nom a-roi maak

examples.original: ผมไปเยี่ยมย่าทุกวันอาทิตย์
examples.translation: I visit my paternal grandmother every Sunday (♂)
examples.phonetic: pom pai yiam ya took wan a-tit

cards.context: Mother's father; Thai distinguishes between maternal and paternal grandparents

examples.original: ตาชอบตกปลา
examples.translation: Maternal grandfather likes to fish
examples.phonetic: ta chob tok pla

examples.original: บ้านตาอยู่ในชนบท
examples.translation: Maternal grandfather's house is in the countryside
examples.phonetic: ban ta yu nai chon-na-bot

cards.context: Mother's mother; Thai distinguishes between maternal and paternal grandparents

examples.original: ยายสอนฉันทำอาหารไทย
examples.translation: Maternal grandmother taught me to cook Thai food
examples.phonetic: yai sorn chan tam a-han thai

examples.original: ฉันชอบไปบ้านยายตอนปิดเทอม
examples.translation: I like going to maternal grandmother's house during school breaks
examples.phonetic: chan chob pai ban yai torn pid term

frontContent.text: ลูกพี่ลูกน้อง

cards.context: General term for cousins (both maternal and paternal)

examples.original: เธอเป็นลูกพี่ลูกน้องของฉัน
examples.translation: She is my cousin
examples.phonetic: ter pen look pee look nong kong chan

examples.original: ลูกพี่ลูกน้องของผมหลายคนอาศัยอยู่ต่างประเทศ
examples.translation: Many of my cousins live abroad (♂)
examples.phonetic: look pee look nong kong pom lai kon a-sai yu tang pra-tet

cards.context: Term for male nephew or grandson; Thai uses the same term for both relationships

examples.original: หลานชายของฉันเพิ่งเกิด
examples.translation: My nephew/grandson was just born
examples.phonetic: lan chai kong chan peng gerd

examples.original: หลานชายคนโตเรียนจบมหาวิทยาลัยแล้ว
examples.translation: The eldest nephew/grandson has already graduated from university
examples.phonetic: lan chai kon to rian job ma-ha-wit-ta-ya-lai laew

cards.context: Term for female niece or granddaughter; Thai uses the same term for both relationships

examples.original: หลานสาวของฉันน่ารักมาก
examples.translation: My niece/granddaughter is very cute
examples.phonetic: lan sao kong chan na-rak maak

examples.original: ฉันซื้อตุ๊กตาให้หลานสาว
examples.translation: I bought a doll for my niece/granddaughter
examples.phonetic: chan seu took-ta hai lan sao

cards.context: Term for father's older brother or mother's older brother; Thai distinguishes uncles by their age relative to parents

examples.original: ลุงของฉันเป็นทหาร
examples.translation: My uncle is a soldier
examples.phonetic: lung kong chan pen ta-han

examples.original: บ้านลุงอยู่ใกล้ทะเล
examples.translation: Uncle's house is near the sea
examples.phonetic: ban lung yu glai ta-le

cards.context: Term specifically for father's sister; Thai has specific terms for different types of aunts

examples.original: ป้าของฉันอาศัยอยู่ในกรุงเทพฯ
examples.translation: My aunt (father's sister) lives in Bangkok
examples.phonetic: pa kong chan a-sai yu nai krung-tep

examples.original: ป้าชอบทำอาหารให้ครอบครัว
examples.translation: Aunt (father's sister) likes to cook for the family
examples.phonetic: pa chob tam a-han hai krob-krua

cards.context: Term for mother's siblings (both brothers and sisters younger than mother); Thai has specific terms for different types of aunts and uncles

examples.original: น้าของฉันมีลูกสามคน
examples.translation: My aunt/uncle (mother's sibling) has three children
examples.phonetic: na kong chan mee look sam kon

examples.original: น้าสาวคนเล็กของแม่เพิ่งแต่งงาน
examples.translation: Mother's youngest sister just got married
examples.phonetic: na sao kon lek kong mae peng tang-ngan
